--- title: Test add to all keywords: fastai sidebar: home_sidebar summary: "Testing `%nbdev_add2__all__` and showing how it works." description: "Testing `%nbdev_add2__all__` and showing how it works." ---
{% raw %}
{% endraw %}

It used to be the case that everything in _all_ had to be quoted.

We now use flags.parse_line for _all_ so you can use code completion etc

{% raw %}
{% endraw %}

The cell above gets written to lib as:

__all__ = ['_not_included_by_default']

%nbdev_add2__all__ can work with anything that could come after _all_=.

You can use square brackets ...

{% raw %} 
def _not_included_by_default2(): pass
%nbdev_add2__all__ ["_not_included_by_default2"]
{% endraw %}

... but you don't have to

{% raw %}
{% endraw %}

It's still true that only the first _all_ or %nbdev_add2__all__ gets picked up by export

{% raw %}
{% endraw %}

You'll see warnings if the list of names is missing ...

{% raw %} 
UsageError: List of names is missing. Usage `%nbev_add2__all__ name_1, name_2`
{% endraw %}

... or if names fail to eval

{% raw %} 
 

UsageError: name 'bad_name' is not defined
{% endraw %}

... but none of these warnings would cause notebook2script or nbdev_build_lib to fail.

You can use space and/or comma separation

{% raw %}
{% endraw %}

and have any amount of other code in a "add2all" cell

{% raw %}
{% endraw %}

As before, only zero indented flags get picked up.

In the following example, show_doc would not be added to __all__ and the module would be broken - because we export everything after %nbdev_export (including %nbdev_add2__all__ show_doc)

%nbdev_export
if True:
    %nbdev_add2__all__ show_doc
    _all_=[show_doc]
